intro: Fumaria macrosepala subsp. boissieri, commonly known as the Persian cress, is a member of the Papaveraceae family. It is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its slender stems and trifoliate leaves. The flowers are small, yellowish-green, and borne in clusters, with four petals. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. The plant is noted for its peppery flavor and has been used in traditional medicine.
